title.narrative: 7.1.1 : INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION

description.narrative: Information and Communition for advocacy of child rights in the CAR, with particular emphasis on the most vulnerable children and women., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Efficient and effective support and management of cross sectoral programming.

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Information and Communition for advocacy of child rights in the CAR, with particular emphasis on the most vulnerable children andwomen.
Fundraising strategy produced to target longer term funding
Fundraising proposals shared monthly with donors (Yes/No)

actual.value: 2015:Ongoing: Proposals shared with the French and Swiss national committees as well as with the governments of Japan, France, ECHO and OCHA.

title.narrative: Compelling videos, stories and photography produced to support awareness-raising, fundraising and donor visibility (Yes/No)

actual.value: 2015:Ongoing: Several Human interest stories and photos produced for donor reporting, blog posts and social networks.

title.narrative: Partnerships are formed with celebrities, religious leaders and opinions leaders to drive advocacy and social engagement with children's issues (Yes/No)
Social media channels contain real-time photos and updates from the field (Yes/No) and Compelling content drives a 20% increase in social media following (Yes/No)

actual.value: 2015:Yes: Social media channels contain real-time photos and updates from the field. Ongoing: UNICEF CAR now has more than 34,000 followers on Facebook, and over 4,200 followers on Twitter.

title.narrative: Advocacy priorities identified in partnership with programme sections (Yes, No) Key messages updated every quarter (Yes, No)

actual.value: 2015:Advocacy priorities have been identified and will be reflected in the updated fundraising strategy. No progress on Key messages

title.narrative: Local journalists are trained in child right's reporting, in partnership with Child Protection section (Yes/No)
Quarterly press conferences organized with local journalists (Yes/No) Quarterly field visits organized with influential journalists (Yes/No)
U-Report is launched in CAR to engage young people to become changemakers in CAR

actual.value: 2015:Yes: U-report was launched late June and has now 13,000 U-reporters.

title.narrative: ORE increased by 20% and OR increased by 10% in 2015 compared to 2014
